intro: Solanum caribaeum, commonly known as the Caribbean nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by berries that range in color from yellow to red. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The leaves are usually ovate or elliptic in shape and have a slightly hairy texture.
